intro: Cyrtandra longifolia var. calpidicarpa, commonly known as the long-fruited cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Its fruit is a distinctive, elongated capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
